intro: Urostigma laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, elongated leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Urostigma laevigatum is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils.
